intro: Orchis purpurea subsp. purpurea, commonly known as the purple orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Europe. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features a tall, erect stem with a single spike of flowers that are usually purple or violet in color. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged along the stem, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. This species is often found in damp meadows, woodlands, and grasslands, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
